DialogOption.texten: 911, what's your emergency?
Hello, there's an older man lying in the underpass. I'm not sure what to do.
{IS HE CONSCIOUS?} Is the man conscious?
{ADDRESS?} Please tell me where are you, ma'am?
{ANY INJURIES?} Does he have any visible injuries?
I don't know, he's acting strangely, flinging around and foaming at his mouth.... am I in danger? There's barely anyone else in here.
I'm in the underpass at [[ADDRESS]]
No, no I think not, but...
{IT'S SEIZURE} Stay calm, it's probably an epileptic seizure.
Epileptic? Oh I know! My uncle was an epileptic. I'm gonna put something in between his jaws.
{DO IT} It's good idea. Try to find something solid enough, which won't break under his teeth.
{DON'T DO THAT} Please don't do that, ma'am! It can only make things worse.
Sure . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . Agh, he bit me! . . . . . Okay, that wasn't easy, but its done. What now?
But my auntie used to do that, so my uncle wouldn't bite his tongue off.
{DON'T DO THAT} It's not the done thing anymore. If he didn't bite his tongue already, then he won't. Putting something in his mouth may result in jaw injury, knocking out a tooth or choking.
{I'LL SEND HELP} I'm sending help. The paramedics are on their way. Please wait for them.
{CLEAR THE AREA} Move away everything that might be dangerous and can result in an injury.
{HOLD HIM} Hold his head to protect him from injuries.
Is that it? Can I just leave him?
Sure . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . I moved the trash can. There is nothing more around.
How exactly I'm supposed to hold it?
So what can I do now?
EMPTY ID: back
{KNEEL BEHIND HIS HEAD} Put your phone on the ground in the speaker mode. You'll need two hands. Please kneel behind his head and then sit back on your knees.
{COMFORTABLE FOR YOU} In any position which is comfortable for you. The seizure might take a while.
Can I just let him go after it ends?
{PLEASE STAY} No, please stay untill the ambulance arrives
{GO TO A DOCTOR} It would be better if he got examined by a doctor after the seizure. He might be exhausted or injured.
{YES} Yes, if he will be consious and without any injuries just let him go.
{PUT HIS HEAD ON YOUR THIGHS} Okay, now lift his head up and move yourself a bit forward so your thighs are under it.
God, his whole body is jerking. I don't know if I can do it...
Okay. I'm waiting. Thanks, goodbye!
I'm sure you'll do well, ma'am. Just do it slowly and be careful.
Ok, now what?
{HOLD HIM} Hold his head firmly on your legs and wait. That's all what you can do for now.
Okay, thanks for the help.
{YES, THAT'S IT} Yes, you can leave now, thank you.
Am I supposed to leave him like this?

reportElement.texten: Caller saw a man with epileptic seizure.
Operator gave wrong medical instruction to the caller.
Caller properly gave first aid to the vicitm thanks to operator's instruction.
